body:
I've been asked by my family if I have any items I'd like for Christmas, and me being the modern teenager I am was extremely helpful and replied "nope".
Yes, very dank I know, who even needs text these days? *insert Lenny face here*

However, I realised that my headset isn't the best and using a PlayStation accessory on a computer isn't that smart.
Yes, you heard me, p-l-a-y... you get the idea. .-. 

Laugh all you want, but this pair of TurtleBeach PLa headset has served it's time well.

Price budget is >£50.01 (75$) (that side ways triangle with one of the sides removed means less than, so smaller than that number). :):)

Please provide a link to it (preferably amazon or the company's official UK website), as well as a reason why I should give my money away for it.

Thanks, but no thanks,
Aura

title: Headset help!

replies.body:
Of you are willing to pay 5 dollars more, HyperX Clous. If you want less accessories than that, for 5$ less than your budget, HyperX Cloud Core.

Also, I used to have that headset, broke in 2 weeks, lmao.

replies.body: That pair has lasted a good year.

replies.body:
What is with gaming gear falling off of tables and dying? First Juano, now you. xd

Anyways, I'm not too good on headsets consider i'm using a $15 that doesn't even fit around my ears properly, but I've heard turtle beach & Logitech make pretty good ones.
